bug.author: felipecode
bug.summary: Pedestrian looses physics when it is activated.
bug.description:
The following code makes the pedestrian go underground. <denchmark-code>import carla import random import time
client = carla.Client('localhost', 2000) client.set_timeout(25.0) world = client.load_world('Town01') blueprint = random.choice(world.get_blueprint_library().filter('walker*')) actor = world.try_spawn_actor(blueprint, carla.Transform(carla.Location(x=216.27, y=129.75, z=1.32062), carla.Rotation(pitch=0, yaw=180, roll=0)))
time.sleep(20.0) print ("GO DOWN")
actor.set_simulate_physics(enabled=True) </denchmark-code>
Basically after you set the physics as true, pedestrians loose physics.
